Class EventManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • EventManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class EventManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Use Case Class that stores all events in the program and enables creation and deletion of events.
    Author:
    Andy, Nithilan
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EventManager()
      Creates an instance of EventManager with no preloaded events.
      EventManager(java.util.ArrayList<Event> events)
      Creates an instance of EventManager with a list of preloaded events.

    • Method Detail

      • createEvent

        public void createEvent(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String room,
                        java.time.LocalDateTime time,
                        java.lang.String speakerName,
                        int capacity,
                        Speaker speaker)
        Creates a new Event and adds event to HashMap of events.
        Parameters:
        name - name of event
        room - room that event takes place in
        time - start time of the event
        speakerName - name of the speaker at this event
        capacity - capacity of the event
        speaker - Speaker object of the speaker of this event

      • getEventsList

        Returns:
        ArrayList of Event objects.

      • getEventsMap

        Gets a map of event id to Event object of all events stored in this EventManager

        HashMap of event id to Event object

      • hasEvent

        public boolean hasEvent(long id)
        checks whether event with given id exists
        Parameters:
        id - id of event being checked
        Returns:
        True or false.
